page.title: 10OLD MANOR FARM, ASHTON
page.content: { Old Manor Farm}covers 312 acres, rising from 120 to 600 feet above sea level. 200 acres are owned and 100 rented from five different landlords. Cropping consists of 120 acres wheat, 50-60 acres parsley and sage grown for processing, 60 acres herbs and salad onions and 45 acres permanent pasture. This is let to a neighbour for his cattle and sheep. 200 acres can be irrigated, half from the Moat Pool and half from the Carrant Brook. All the grain grown can be stored on the farm and there are 2 full time staff. A certain amount of tree planting has been carried out and hedgerow saplings are encouraged to grow to maturity. A small plantation of plums is kept for it's amenity value as are a number of old barns. The house which dates back to 1638 was the Squire's former Manor House.
